content: Packed with some new features and minor upgrades from previous version. Matchday feature is very nice and puts you into mood. To summarize I didn't have any crash or anything so far. (Samsung s5e). Small but neat updates from FM20 (touchline shots, better UI and some improvements on tactics screen) Worth the upgrade if you are a regular player and strongly recommended if you are to start the series. EDIT: As soon as I post this there was an update which fixed some of the bugs I've mentioned. Thanks for that, graphics on matchday is much crispier now but that is causing significant drop in FPS to a point where it is not playable anymore. Please put an option to change matchday resolution, I'd rather play with better FPS instead of crispier graphics. EDIT2: Thank you for your swift response and quick fix of the laggy match engine. Game is much more playable and smooth now. I will keep on reporting bugs if I find more but raising it to 4 stars to reflect my recommendations.

content: I for one am really enjoying this, and despite the errors sometimes, i can easilly chalk it down to my phone. I do think limiting to 3 countries is a bit of a blow, and other teams in the best aren't having their actual squads if you don't pick that league. It takes away from the experience in my opinion.

replyContent: Hi Christian, thanks for the review. We'd recommend that you email help@sega.co.uk about your current issue.

content: Some shiny new features (more data analysis, in-game shouts); shame that they rarely seem to work. Game is buggier than the Amazon. Infographics show up blank half the time (star ratings, match analysis, details on tactics screen), most hyperlinks don't work, some drop-down menus can't be closed, buttons disappearing, can't highlight players during highlights, Assistant Manager seems to give far fewer tactical insights during matches (and doesn't make sense when they do - e.g. bring on players already on the field), players 'overwhelmed' after receiving two shouts in 45 minutes, VAR decisions being 100% predictable (fouls confirmed as penalties, fouls near edge of box confirmed as free-kicks, dubiously offside goals disallowed). All of this serves to provide the user with a very clunky and frustrating experience, which prevents the game from feeling like the 'simulation' that it should. Save yourself ¬£20 and play last year's version until a suitable update is released.
replyContent:
Hi James, thanks for the review. Please log any bugs or issues you believe you've found with the game on our forums at the link provided so we can address them.

https://community.sigames.com/forum/836-bugs-found-on-android/

Now on my 5th season as Man United manager and have been the Manager of the year 3 times. Have brought back United to where it belongs . Loving the game.
